image.altText: A man sits on a stage with a headphone mic on

props.synopsis: South Australia's former Liberal leader David Speirs says a federal takeover of the state's branch should be 'seriously considered' but current leader Vincent Tarzia disagrees.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader suggests federal takeover of state division

image.altText: Side profile of man with curly, dark hair and stubble. He wears a shirt and jacket and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney General Kyam Maher will address "gaps" in the state's law after a young mother's killer was sentenced to 11 years behind bars after he was found to be experiencing drug-induced hallucinations at the time of the offence.Â

title.children: SA attorney-general looks to remove self-intoxication as criminal defence

image.altText: a group of four women make cheers at a table covered in colourful drawings and textas

props.synopsis: The question of how to make friends in a regional town is often answered with joining a local sports club. But in South Australia's Riverland, a group is finding other ways to connect socially.

title.children: How do you make friends when you're new in town and don't like sport?

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks to media, as seen in an AI video

props.synopsis: Showing how easy it is to make deepfakes of politicians using artificial intelligence, independent senator David Pocock creates AI videos of Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Opposition Leader Peter Dutton.

title.children: David Pocock creates AI deepfakes of Albanese and Dutton as warning ahead of election

image.altText: Chad Warner gets a handball away while Sam Taylor tackles him

props.synopsis: Sydney and GWS's critical qualifying final kicks off a big Saturday of finals footy, before Brisbane and Carlton play to keep their seasons alive at the Gabba. Follow live.Â

title.children: Swans and Giants play for more than local bragging rights in Sydney derby qualifying final

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: HT: Giants fantastic and lead the Swans by 21 points
Papley and Greene spark a quarter-time brawl
QT: Giants lead Swans by seven after hot first quarter

image.altText: Long green stalks of grass in plastic pots for collecting data. In the background is blue clear sky.

props.synopsis: Weeds cost Australia's crop farming industry around $3.3 billion dollars each year, but a home-grown invention that crushes herbicide-resistant weed seeds could make that a problem of the past.

title.children: Farmer invents machinery that smashes 'bejesus' out of weed seeds

image.altText: police gather on a sporting girl

props.synopsis: As authorities investigate a hammer-throwing incident which critically injured a 13-year-old boy at a suburban Adelaide athletics ground, police say the "tragic" situation appears to have been the result of an "incredibly unfortunate accident".

title.children: Teenage hammer-throwing victim 'fighting for his life' after 'tragic' accident at suburban sports ground

image.altText: a cane toad

props.synopsis: A biosecurity analyst says cane toads have travelled long distances on cars trucks to end up in places where new populations would not be welcome.

title.children: Hitchhiking cane toads pose threat to southern Australia

image.altText: Mother and child hug anonymous generic

props.synopsis:
Amber feared her daughter was being sexually abused by her ex. A family court judge said she was projecting her own experiences onto her daughter, and she lost custody.

Â 

Â

title.children: Amber's sister made a 'malicious' report to child safety about her parenting. It found its way into her family court case

image.altText: A footballer weaves her way through traffic with ball in hand.

props.synopsis: Ally Anderson stars with 42 touches as last year's AFLW premiers get their first win of season 2024 on the board.

title.children: Lions get first win on the board as star midfielder Anderson equals the AFL disposals record

image.altText: An OzHarvest volunteer packs a package of biscuits into a woman's shopping bag

props.synopsis: As Australian households struggle with cost of living, charities are feeling the pressure â with food relief services in particular saying demand has never been greater.

title.children: 'Not enough anymore': Workers turn to food charity as Australians go without bare essentials

image.altText: William Gulson

props.synopsis: English teacher William Gulson, 27, has been charged with grooming a child online.

title.children: Teacher from Knox Grammar allegedly asked 15yo if they 'found it hot' being the same age as his students

image.altText: A map showing Muswellbrook NSW.

props.synopsis: The Seismology Research Centre has recorded a magnitude-4.5 earthquake near Muswellbrook.

title.children: 'The bedroom just shook and shook': Magnitude-4.5 earthquake hits NSW

image.altText: Perth Mint gold

props.synopsis: Gold has been relentlessly surging to new records. So what's behind the recent demand?

title.children: Why gold prices are a warning sign, and what it tells us about global stability

image.altText: Dr Saul Karnovsky in his office at Curtin University in Perth looking and writing notes.

props.synopsis:
An education researcher warns burnout is driving teachers out of the profession in droves and staff shortages in schools across the country next year will be far worse than authorities are predicting.

Â

title.children: 'The pay's not the issue': Burnout causing teachers to quit, prompting staff shortage concerns

image.altText: image of Israeli tank operating in Gaza

props.synopsis: The controversial "Hannibal Directive", which Israel says isn't named for the famous Carthaginian general who took poison rather than be captured by the Romans, was reportedly enacted after the October 7 Hamas attack, with revelations detailing attacks by IDF tanks and helicopters on homes and vehicles returning to Gaza.

title.children: Israel accused of killing its own civilians under the 'Hannibal Directive' to avoid them being taken hostage

image.altText: Jim Chalmers wears a navy suit, looking solemnly off camera.

props.synopsis: With the national accounts this week showing the economy barely registering a pulse, more oxygen was expended on accusing the treasurer of being mean to the Reserve Bank than on what is happening in the economy.

title.children: Instead of studying the tectonic shifts of the economy, we're burning oxygen on the treasurer being 'mean' to the RBA

image.altText: A close up of Taylor Swift wearing a black corset top and raising a glass at a football game.

props.synopsis: Earlier this year, Australian designer Dion Lee was making waves in the fashion world after his corset top was debuted by the most famous woman in the world. How did all go so wrong for this local brand?

title.children: Just months ago, Dion Lee was dressing Taylor Swift. How did it go so wrong for this Australian brand?

image.altText: Elle Macpherson walks the runway for Ngali during the Melbourne Fashion Festival

props.synopsis: Not all voices carry in the same way; not everyone has clout: Macpherson does, and while she is right to say that she's entitled to tell her story, it's also true that it's dangerous to shout "fire" in a crowded theatre.

title.children: When Elle Macpherson revealed her 'heart-led, holistic approach' to treating cancer, I thought of my nanny

image.altText: Tennis player Jannik Sinner sits in a chair at courtside and reacts in pain as a medic examines his wrist during a big match.

props.synopsis: A chaotic US Open semifinal sees Jannik Sinner play through the pain barrier to beat Jack Draper after the ailing Briton throws up repeatedly on court â now the world number one will face American Taylor Fritz in the final.

title.children: Injured Jannik Sinner downs ailing Jack Draper to reach US Open final

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt and hat smiles for a photo

title.children: Brazilian musical trailblazer SÃ©rgio Mendes dies aged 83

image.altText: The unmanned Boeing Starliner capsule leaving the international space station

props.synopsis: After months of turmoil over its safety, Boeing's new astronaut capsule has departed the International Space Station, headed for Earth, without its crew.

title.children: Starliner capsule leaves International Space Station without astronauts

image.altText: Smiling middle-aged Caucasian tall man in green tee, shorter woman, mustard sweater in front of cream door, weatherboard house.

props.synopsis: When actress Linda and singer Dan expanded their late-night real estate searches to include some far-flung corners of Victoria, it changed their lives in every way.

title.children: The O'Gradys thought they'd be 'forever renters' in the city, until they saw a country cottage going for a song

image.altText: Donald Trump has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: A New York judge postpones Donald Trump's sentencing for his "hush money" crimes until after the upcoming US election.Â

title.children: Trump's sentencing in porn star 'hush money' case delayed until after election

image.altText: A composite image showing Wayne Swan handing down the budget in 2008 and Jim Chalmers handing down this budget.

props.synopsis: Labor frustrations with Jim Chalmers's mild-mannered, hand-picked RBA governor spilled into the open this week.

title.children: A pair of Labor treasurers delivered a one-two 'punch' to the RBA this week. It was a strategy, not an accident.

image.altText: A man with a beard stands in front of the Australian War Memorial and looks into the camera.

props.synopsis:
In the past two weeks, more than 200 current and former service personnel have pledged their brains to the Australian Veterans Brain Bank, after the ABC reported growing evidence of a link between mild traumatic brain injury associated with blast exposure and poor mental health and suicide.

Â

title.children: Khalil served 34 years in the military. He has pledged his brain to science to help other veterans

image.altText: A composite image of a broadcasting tower with a sign reading "ten" and an image of a woman with blonde hair smiling.

props.synopsis: Network Ten reporter Tegan George's bid to sue her employer over trauma she says she suffered covering the bushfire season in 2019 and 2020 ends in a confidential settlement.

title.children: Network Ten reporter Tegan George reaches settlement with broadcaster over bushfire trauma

image.altText: Politicians sit on the lower house benches in a wide view capturing the entire lower house floor.

props.synopsis: Parliament is considering new laws to penalise bad behaviour inside the nation's seat of power. But how much has changed since Brittany Higgins's allegation of rape three years ago forced an upheaval?

title.children: Since Brittany Higgins's rape allegation, how much has parliament's culture really improved?

image.altText: Hands hold up a gold, silver and bronze medal

props.synopsis: Keep up with how many medals Aussie athletes won overnight â and where Australia sits on the leaderboard.Â

title.children: Here are the medal standings after day nine of the Paralympic Games

image.altText: Man with grey hair wearing striped gray prison unifrom appears in court

props.synopsis: The father and son appeared in back-to-back hearings on Friday morning local time, with about 50 onlookers in the courtroom.

title.children: Father of Georgia school shooting suspect remanded in custody after appearing in court

image.altText: A man wearing a military uniform looking on.

props.synopsis: Ukraine has managed to capture more territory in a month than Russia has in a year, but with troops stretched and Putin's forces closing in on a key transport hub, some are questioning whether Kyiv's surprise invasion of the Kursk region was a good idea.

title.children: Ukraine's invasion of Russia was seen by some as a masterstroke, but it might backfire

image.altText: An FBI police vehicle

props.synopsis: US law enforcement officials says the 20-year-old Pakistan national "planned a terrorist attack in New York City around October 7th of this year with the stated goal of slaughtering, in the name of ISIS, as many Jewish people as possible".

title.children: Man charged with plotting mass shooting at US Jewish centre on anniversary of Hamas attack

image.altText: Closeup of small turtle being held in front of grasslands.

props.synopsis: An endangered tortoise that excited wildlife carers by surviving outside its only known habitats in Perth has returned home to its birthplace and site of a relocation trial in WA's South West.

title.children: Hopes for future hatchlings outside Perth as rare western swamp tortoise returns to southern home

image.altText: an old clipping from a cookbook named the perfect custard tart with a picnic blanket behind it

props.synopsis: A CWA branch is reviving vintage recipes like meatloaf, broken glass jelly and Weet-Bix slice to help modern-day families save money.Â

title.children: Fancy some vinegar cake or broken-glass jelly? These women are reviving vintage recipes amid the cost-of-living crisis
